Review.Titre: Beware - Expensive auto renew
Review.Contenu: Signed up for software in October 2020.  Cost $49.50 with a discount.  No mention of auto renew taking money from by debit card, or I wouldn't have signed up. Billed $27.80 in December 2021. No email warning to tell me that I had auto renewed.  Such a small amount I didn't even notice it coming off my debit card. Billed $179 in December 2022 from my debit card. No email reminder or warning. Just noticed. Excruciatingly difficult to turn auto-renew off on the website.  Keep sending you round in circles if you want to cancel.  Beware.Further to PC Protects comments below, going to the the 'Disable auto renew' section gives three options.  Regardless of the option chosen they just send you back into the classic loop of not wanting to lose your business and making it unbelievably difficult to simply cancel auto renew.  If you select 'Pricing issue'  you get 'We're sorry to hear you have a concern with the price of your PCProtect subscription, and we'd really hate to see you leave, running the risk of being unprotected from harmful threats online. If you really want to cancel your account and risk being unprotected from online threats you can do so in your account, or you can continue below by clicking next.'  There is no 'next' button on the page.  The other 2 options are in a similar vein. Even when you follow the  'my account' link (which is the only place it appears on their website,) and you are able to disable autorenew, they STILL KEEP YOUR DEBIT CARD DETAILS on your account screen even though my account is paid up for the next 11 months and I don't want to renew.  Now I'm going to have to go through the hassle of cancelling that debit card to make sure they don't take any more payments.  Once again. Beware.

The remain button, as I inadvertently found out sets off a celebratory message saying stuff like 'Great you are staying' and other such crap. The leave button required your password confirming your decision. As  I had stripped my machine of all mention of this lot I had to try and find my password. I should point out that I suffer with a nerve problem akin to Parkinsonism but thank God it is not quite that bad. In my rush to shed myself of this crap business I pressed the wrong button. Why didn't I need a password to remain, why do they ignore everything that has gone before and why have they yet to reply to my communications. My message to this shower is simple, you've been fired, you are not wanted and in my world you are a bunch of charlatans feigning respectability.If they decide to dip into my PayPal account I'll let you know.

Unscrupulous Practices and Appalling Customer Services - Avoid!
Review.Contenu: This company is unscrupulous, devious and untrustworthy.  Their customer services people consistently ignore your questions & requests and they appear to be clueless when it comes to managing a technical problem through to resolution.   My system failed recently leaving me without the internet security & virus protection I had paid for.  I initially contacted the company’s Chat Support line for help, but after 3 days and numerous product uninstall/reinstall procedures (at their request) it became apparent that they were no closer to a solution, so I asked that the issue be escalated.Their 'Technical Supervisors' group eventually replied and for the next 8 days they did nothing but return inept suggestions & responses, showed no urgency whatsoever and no willingness to (attempt to) isolate or circumvent the problem in order to get me back online - and they tried to blame my system/Windows for the problem!   Finally, after 13 days, I decided to call their UK number in order to raise a complaint and no sooner had I completed the call than an email popped up outlining a solution to the problem!   So, they wasted my time, 'fobbed me off' for almost two weeks, were clueless as to how to tackle the problem and they obviously knew about it all along - and they do not have a complaints procedure! I have an audit trail of exchanged emails to support all of the above.The company also operate a scandalous subscription renewal practice which defaults to 'auto-renew' at registration time (if there's a choice it is very well hidden!) and when a reminder email is sent 30-days prior to term expiry they sneakily do not mention the renewal cost!If you do not cancel before term end you are charged a scandalous amount for renewal - probably four times what you paid for the first year's cover.  Whether this practice is legal or not is one thing, but there's no doubt in my mind that it is unscrupulous and IMO has no place if a company genuinely wishes to operate in a fair and decent manner. I paid £29.94 for the first year and discovered that the renewal cost would have been £119.70. Please be aware that this company market both the Total AV and PC Protect products, but the customer support services are effectively managed by the same people/organisation within the parent company (SS Protect Limited).   Just check the Terms of Service for each product website.

Review.Titre: I started using PC Protect about a…
Review.Contenu: I started using PC Protect about a month/month and a half ago.  At first, FIVE STARS!!!  I set it up, I installed it on all my devices, I scanned, I checked, I did all the things a "home admin" that works for a computer software company is supposed to do.  I even went so far as to get the Identity Protection Plan and it helped me locate an ex wife that means harm and make sure that MY DATA was protected and that I was doing the necessary things to keep HER out of mine and my family's life.  Well, it came time to check up on the ID Protection.  Consistently now, I get and error message when connecting.  I e-mailed support.  I spend all day on the phone so I won't call.  I heard back only to provide what was asked for in the way of exact messages and screen shots and have heard NOTHING.  Absolutely NOTHING.  I'll give you the protection of the PC part of what your software does.  But I won't vouch for your ID Protection piece because you won't respond to my e-mail messages.  Let's just say I'm a bit disappointed and I will be seeking other protection when the time comes and that will be very soon.

Review.Titre: THIS APP IS REALLY GOOD!!!
Review.Contenu: THIS APP IS REALLY GOOD!!! The below information was before I started checking out the features!! There are so many things that I was unaware of!! I was using Microsoft Defender & this works better. I have had 2 ransomware infections that really scared me. The first one was very bad. It didn't allow me any access to my computer/files/restore point. I had to consult a computer guru for that one. I thought the computer was a goner. The second one allowed me access to my task manager. The app that was using the most power was Google. I was able to close that app in the task manager & that fixed it. This app seems to have more features. I am hoping that using a different browser and this app can do the trick!
